Notes: Many types of citrus are available, including oranges, white grapefruit, tangelos, and lemons.

Crop: Lemons; Apples; Chili Peppers; Pumpkins; Medjool Dates; Sweet Corn
You pick?: U-Pick;  Farm Stand; Farmers Market;  Restaurant; Tours
Hours of operation: Citrus U-Pick: Saturday 8-3; Farm Stand: Saturday & Sunday 8-12; 24 hour self-service; Agritopia Farmers Markets: Wednesday 4-8; Saturday 8-3
Notes: Agritopia is an "urban farm" designed to flourish in the urban setting of suburban Phoenix.  A great source for organic produce of all types.

85 varieties of citrus fruit plus olives, apples, figs, and more! The fourth-generation Arizona citrus farmer who managed the citrus farm when it was the university's Citrus Agricultural Center in Waddell since 1988 continues to nurture the 40 acres.
Tours are available. This venue hosts the yearly lavender festival in June.
This off-the-grid lavender farm offers classes at their Heber botique.

Farm/Grower: Lavender Herb Farm and Tea House
Hours of operation: First and third Saturdays of every month
Notes: A wide variety of lavender is available here. The tea house hosts two special teas per month and is open for special events. Please see website for details.

Crop: Honey; Sweet Corn; Pumpkins; Chili Peppers
Notes: This large farm hosts special events, offers tours, and hosts two festivals a year: the Sweet Corn Festival in late August and a Pumpkin Festival in October complete with corn maze. Throughout the year it offers vegetables and meats as well as a variety of sweets in their country store.

Crop: Honey; Chili Peppers; Sweet Corn; Pumpkins; Romaine Lettuce
You pick?: U-Pick; Country Store; Tours; Special Events; Guest Lodging
Hours of operation: Daily 7-6; U-Pick open June-October by appointment.
Notes: A working farom with a variety of organic produce and opportunities to learn or discover with classes and tours.

Hours of operation: Saturday 8-noon (summer hours 7:00 - 11:00 am). Farm stand opens November 2
Notes: A community-centric farm with opportunities for volunteeers. Honey, dates, and a whole variety of veggies (lots of tomatoes) even a few fruits.

Hours of operation: Sunday - Thursday 8-5; Friday - Saturday: 8:00 am - 9:00 pm; Tours: 7 days a week, 9:30-3:30 hourly. $5.00 per person, Children under 12 get free admittance.  Large groups can be accommodated with advance notice.
Notes: Arizona's only olive mill presses the tree harvest into delicious oil on site. Country store offers a variety of fine olive oils and more. Come explore with a tour or grab a bite at the del Piero Winery.
A full farm with a variety of produce and a petting zoo.

WTF?: These coordinates are from the special farm from their website.
Notes: Mostly a pasture and ranch, events include a fall pumpkin festival as well as a garlic and onion festival in summer and an Easter Egg Hunt in spring. This location is available for private events such as weddings, and offers field trips and a petting zoo to school-age children throughout the month of October.

You pick?: U-Pick; Events; Country Store; Farm Stand
Hours of operation: Country Store at 1510 N Circle I Rd in Willcox open year round. Orchards and farm stand open July-October. See website for details.
Notes: Sweet corn, apple, peach, and pumpkin festivals as well as u-pick opportunities at three locations.

Farm/Grower: Buckelew Farm Pumpking Festival and Corn Maze
Notes: Open in fall to special events including a u-pick pumpkin festival, tours to school groups, and a haunted house and haunted corn maze in the evenings. Also a Christmas tree lot.
Saveral varieties of pumpkins for grabs in the boutique pumpkin patch. The Freeman Farms Pumpkin Festival boasts sweet corn for grilling, performance venues, petting zoo, corn maze, and more.
Organic apples and pears, kosher and halal meats and Arizona's largest herd of beefalo cattle. Picnic area for guests.
Every day is an adventure with a petting zoo, mini maze, special accommodations for school children, and several special events, including a snow day.

Crop: Pumpkins; Chili Peppers; Romaine Lettuce; Apples
You pick?: U-Pick; Events; Tours; Community Farm Stand; Country Store; Guest Lodging; Museum
Hours of operation: Open year round. Hours vary according to season.
Notes: A designated Arizona Treasure, this farm offers a year-round variety of u-pick organic vegetables as well as tours, festivals, various markets, and a field to hold your own event.

Hours of operation: Farm Stand: Daily 9-5 (seasonal). U-Pick: Monday & Wednesday & Friday 8 -12.
Notes: Pumpkins, mazes, field trips, and a full on agricultural bonanza.
This small family u-pick farm offers a variety of produce and distributes to restaurants in the Sonoita area.
A family fun place with a fall festival and even a mud run event.

Location: SE Corner of Brown and Center St
Hours of operation: Monday-Saturday 7. Open Memorial Day weekend through July.
Notes: Sweet corn and other summer crops are available at the barn and farm stand, as well as a variety of produce from other Arizona direct growers.

Family owned orchard and guest ranch growing over 29 varities of apples in the Miller Canyon ares of the Huachuca Mountains. Many of the trees were burned by the 2011 fire in that area but the orchard has been replanted and should bear fruit within the next several years.
Boasting a wide variety of apple and pear trees. Apple cider also available.
U-Pick opportunity for organic apples, also a source for tomatoes, cucumbers, and other tree fruit.

Hours of operation: call for information. Open Mid-June through September
Notes: Organic apples, peaches, and blackberries.
Organic apples and peaches.

Location: about 7.4 miles from the intersection of Highway 366 (Swift Trail) and Highway 191. Shortly after Noon Creek, watch for the Angle Orchard sign on the south side of the road and follow the turnoff to the orchard.
Notes: Organic apples and peaches.
Local produce and meats, including goats and pigs.

Farm/Grower: Santa Cruz Chili and Spice Co
Notes: Located in the heart of the Santa Cruz Valley this company is both a manufacturer and retailer of fine chili products and also sells a wide variety of gourmet Southwestern foods, cookbooks and a large selection of spices and herbs.
Over 100 varieties of vegetables, flowers, and herbs.
